Nooku Framework extension wins Joomla Developers’ Showdown

31 July 2009 by Johan

Last month Brian Teeman (Joomla co-founder) ran an unofficial Joomla Developers Showdown. The premise was to create a fully functional and documented extension in four days. The extension had to meet some basic requirements based around a concept of a company directory.

Beer without the headaches

Being a competitive bunch we couldn’t resist...

Nooku Framework launch at Joomladays Netherlands

23 June 2009 by Johan

The Nooku team was at the[ Joomladays in the Netherlands][1] last week, both as sponsors and as speakers. The Dutch Joomladays are traditionally one of the biggest Joomla events globally, and this year was no different. Organised by Guido Jansen, the driving force of Dutch community site, the event hosted some 300 attendees and over 20 speakers, spread...

Nooku TV – Anahita Social Engine for Joomla!

11 June 2009 by Johan

In the second episode of Nooku TV Pete Russell talks to web architect Rastin Mehr, of rmdstudio.com,  about Anahita, a new social engine framework for Joomla. At its core Anahita is powered by our own [Nooku Framework][1].

Rastin’s experience with Nooku Framework took Anahita to unexpected levels :

  • rmd Studio discovers Nooku Framework
  • Subsequently entirely re-wrote Anahita (using Nooku) in six...

    Announcing Nooku Code Jam in Hamburg

    10 June 2009 by Johan

    Last month, the team at Delius, one of our Nooku partners, organised the first Nooku Code Jam in Ghent, Belgium. Among the visitors where Sascha and Steffan from YOOTheme, creators of the Zoo extension. The Nooku Framework must have made quite an impression. Not only are they looking into using it for their new extensions, they also agreed to organize a...

    Classicalmasterclasses Goes Live in Five Languages

    10 June 2009 by Johan

    Classicalmasterclasses.com, the new search portal for music masterclasses has gone online. Professors and institutions can register their courses and students can easily search them with different filters. The site has been built with Joomla and is powered by Nooku Content. To capture an international audience classes are offered in five languages: German, English, Italian, French and Spanish.

    Continue reading
